summary: Design and build a conversion-optimized marketing website for Rainbowz Mind Studio (children’s brain training brand) with defined IA/pages, UI style guide, wireframes, copy, and a React + Tailwind frontend implementation intended to be made live.
architectural_notes: Implement reusable UI components (e.g., Container/Section, Buttons, Cards, Grids, Navbar/Footer) and page sections (Hero, ProblemCards, Framework diagram, Steps, Outcomes, Testimonials, CTAs) per blueprint.
Site pages to implement: Home, About Rainbowz, Our Method, Programs (age-wise), Results & Outcomes, Parents’ Guide/Education, Contact/Book Demo.
known_issues: Attempt to start the frontend build previously failed with an AI/tooling error ('Our AI couldn't handle that request'); user retried the request.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Abstract geometric hero overlay with cognitive-themed shapes (hero-overlay.dim_1600x900.png)
- Thin-line icon set (focus, memory, speed, creativity, assess, train, strengthen, apply) in a consistent style (thinline-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png)
- Technique→Brain Skill→Better Learning diagram in calm scientific style (method-flow-diagram.dim_1400x400.png)
- Age-wise development staircase diagram (age-staircase.dim_1200x600.png)
- Minimal neural network dots/lines graphic with one accent node (science-network.dim_1200x600.png)

existing_features.title: Implement the full multi-page marketing website frontend for “Rainbowz Mind Studio” using React + TypeScript and Tailwind CSS, based on the approved information architecture and page layouts: Home, About, Our Method, Programs, Results & Outcomes, Parents’ Guide, and Contact / Book Demo.

Create shared layout and UI building blocks to ensure consistency across all pages: Navbar, Footer, Container/Section primitives, headings/subheadings, buttons (primary/secondary), card variants, grid presets, and reusable CTA blocks.
Apply the provided UI style guide as the site-wide design system in Tailwind (colors, typography, spacing, and overall “calm scientific” aesthetic). Use English for all user-facing text.

Implement the “Our Method” page with the specified structure and visuals: system overview diagram (Technique → Brain Skill → Better Learning), four brain-skill cards (Focus, Working Memory, Processing Speed, Creativity), technique category blocks (high-level only), age-wise development staircase (5–7, 8–10, 11–14), simple science network graphic (dots/lines), and a two-column comparison table (Traditional vs Rainbowz).

Implement the Programs page with an age-group selector (5–7, 8–10, 11–14) and corresponding program detail sections including: what this age needs (1-line), skills trained, weekly structure, and a “Book Demo for This Age” CTA for each group, plus a concise FAQ strip.

Implement the Contact / Book Demo page with a form that captures: parent name, child age, phone, and preferred time, plus a “Map-like” visual block and alternate contact options (call and WhatsApp) rendered as UI elements (non-functional placeholders if no integration is provided).

Add a coherent, consistent visual theme across the site (calm scientific, child-friendly but not childish) using generous whitespace, bento-style cards, subtle geometric accents, thin-line iconography, and minimal abstract diagrams—ensuring the theme is applied consistently on every page.

Generate and include required static visual assets (abstract diagrams/illustrations and thin-line icons) as local static files under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the relevant sections (Hero, Our Method diagrams, and generic iconography).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build the full website frontend application in React + Tailwind (all required pages and shared components) based on the approved structure, style guide, and copy
